pullRequest.body:
---

Please check whether the new version is a correct description.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Actually it might be better to emphasize that IsDomain is a mixin now and not part of the heierachy. So it's not actually a predecessor in a literal sense
Would you remove `IsDomain` from the comments, or change the wording?
I would change the wording to `Ring` + `IsDomain` with linear order (or whatever the correct version is)

I couldn't make sense out of it (i.e., I didn't find a combination `IsDomain` + something where `IsDomain` wouldn't be redundant for given purposes). If you find something, please, fill it in; otherwise, I better delete these two lines.

I am not saying it is ideal thing to do to the docs, but it is certainly better now than what there was before.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: madvorak can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thank you @YaelDillies !

Shouldn't " & `+` respects `â‰¤` & `*` respects `<` " be there as well?
I am not sure what exactly implies the rest of the properties.
The point was to relate to non-order properties, so no it wouldn't make much sense.

> The point was to relate to non-order properties, so no it wouldn't make much sense.

Should it be removed from lines 68, 74, 81, 88 then?

No, I mean the point of *those two specific lines*. Each item in a sublist removes one condition from the corresponding header. The ones about `IsDomain` are precisely removing the compatibility between algebraic and order operations.
Sorry; it seems I don't understand what `IsDomain` does. If you are sure it is now correct, I will trust you and merge it as is.
`IsDomain` just says that `a * b = 0 â†’ a = 0 âˆ¨ b = 0`. This is a consequence of linearity of the order + compatibility of the algebraic operations, but it is a purely algebraic condition.
And what implies that `+` respects `â‰¤` then?

I think you are misunderstanding the point of this whole paragraph in the docs. It's supposed to answer questions of the form "I stated a lemma using `LinearOrderedRing` but never used the compatibility of `*` with `â‰¤` for anything else than `a * b = 0 â†’ a = 0 âˆ¨ b = 0`. What should I do?", the answer to which would be "Use `Ring` + `IsDomain` + maybe `LinearOrder`".

Yeah, I misunderstood it totally!

Should I merge it now as it is?
The docstring did slightly go out of date (since `Domain` is no more) and I'm happy with this PR in its current form, so please do!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7181657350/job/19556508234)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7181657350/job/19556508005)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7181657350/job/19556507513)

It does make sense. I pushed a fix with the new appropriate description.

maintainer merge

It does make sense. I pushed a fix with the new appropriate description.

maintainer merge
